pr_title: [Feature: Forum] Use websockets in Discussion Forum
pr_body:
### Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements:

* [ ] The PR title and message follows our [guidelines](https://submitty.org/developer/how_to_contribute)
* [ ] Tests for the changes have been added/updated (if possible)
* [ ] Documentation has been updated/added if relevant

### What is the current behavior?
Closes #4328 
The discussion forum fetches new data from server only upon refresh while changes happen without the user noticing.
Closes #5517 

### What is the new behavior?
Using web sockets in the discussion forum will introduce real-time updates without having the users to refresh the page every now and then to get the latest updates, this also reduces the load on the server as changes occur at the client window (browser).

### Other information?
This PR is based on the sockets code introduced in PR #5205 , you have to go by this PR in order to enable websockets in the forum.
This PR also grabs some functionality in PR #4329 which contains initial code for using websockets in the forum.

```

ws_dict_msg = json.loads(ws_str_msg)
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 17, 20, 30, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marwanatef2', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443305943, 'comment_body': 'Does this not introduce the same problem? pr_title: [Feature: Forum] Use websockets to update posts in Discussion Forum
pr_body:
### What is the current behavior?
The discussion forum use websockets only to update threads (adding, deleting, merging, etc.)

### What is the new behavior?
The discussion forum should fully work with websockets updating both threads and posts on real-time basis.

### Other information?
This PR should not be merged unless PR #5529  is merged since it is based on it.

", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 3, 15, 26, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'marwanatef2', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 449687919, 'comment_body': "Let's make this a broad issue to clean up all of the usages of `$GLOBALS` in the ForumController and ForumView, not just this one.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 3, 19, 24, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MasterOdin', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: [SYSADMIN ACTION][Feature:InstructorUI] websockets in office hours queue
pr_body:
### What is the current behavior?
The office hours queue makes a request every 30 seconds to check if there is an update in the queue, and if so it renders the parts of the page that needs to get updated without refreshing the whole page.

### What is the new behavior?
Introducing websockets in the office hourse queue will only update the page on new socket messages without the need to ask (request) every 30 seconds whether there is an update or not.

### Other information
To enable websockets in order to test this PR please see [Docs](https://submitty.org/sysadmin/version_notes/v20.06.00)

[ draft docs PR : https://github.com/Submitty/submitty.github.io/pull/272 ]

pr_body:
### What is the current behavior?
Students/Graders should refresh the page to get new posts in the grade inquiry discussion which may be boring if the discussion goes a long way or may be they will forget and the inquiry will not be resolved in the same time of discussion.

### What is the new behavior?
The grade inquiry discussion is updated on the go with websockets whether new posts are added of the inquiry is resolved users will get the updates immediately.

### Other information?
In order to test you'll need to have websockets enabled, so please check the [docs](https://submitty.org/sysadmin/version_notes/v20.06.00)

pr_body:
### Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements:

* [ ] The PR title and message follows our [guidelines](https://submitty.org/developer/how_to_contribute)
* [ ] Tests for the changes have been added/updated (if possible)

### What is the current behavior?
Simple grading (checkpoints / numeric) is accessed by multiple graders simultaneously but doesn't refresh upon changes so graders can't see the latest page updates.

### What is the new behavior?
Integrating websockets in simple grading will allow changes to any checkpoint/numeric-input to take place concurrently on all open graders pages (windows) so they can see the latest updates in real time.
